content.question: European monarchs of the 1700s mostly attempted to promote trade and consumption in luxury items by following

choices.label: mercantilist policies that protected domestic industries and encouraged the creation of colonies
free trade policies that allowed countries to specialize in producing goods for which they had a competitive advantage
policies that emphasized economic self-sufficiency and avoided dependence on goods or resources from other countries
policies that created state-owned industries and wealth-redistribution programs

content.answer: mercantilist policies that protected domestic industries and encouraged the creation of colonies
